channel.title: How in the......... do i do this
channel.description:
I DON'T NEED THE ANSWERS I JUST NEED TO KNOW HOW TO DO THIS.
1: 120 is increased to 336 180% 18% 36%
2: 280 is increased to 560 50% 100% 200%
3: 280 is decreased to 112 30% 50% 60%
4: 320 is increased to 420 31.25% 36% 76%
5: 10 is increased to 18 80% 8% 40%
6: 280 is decreased to 14 82% 90% 95%
7: 24 is increased to 84 200% 250% 300%
8: 100 is decreased to 8 92% 920% 46%
9: 310 is increased to 341 5% 31% 10%
10: 240 is increased to 288 20% 24% 48%
11: 240 is increased to 1128 3.7% 37% 370%

item.title: How in the......... do i do this
item.dc:creator: @SuperNewb SuperNewb
item.description:
@SuperNewb wrote:

[center][u]second number-first number[/u][/center]
[center]first number[/center]

subtract the 2nd and 1st numbers, then divide it by the first number.
if you get a positive number, it is a percent of increase
if you get a negative number, it is a percent of decrease
the preceeding took 2 minutes to research (math book)

Read full topic

item.title: How in the......... do i do this
item.dc:creator: @yna_ajhear5 yna_ajhear5
item.description:
@yna_ajhear5 wrote:

It want to know how much % is increased by.

So you take the first number (120), and divide it by the second one (336).

It equals .35 or 35%
So the answer is 36% (the best choice).

It works fine with the others, so have fun.

Read full topic
